definition: to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request

sentences.english: This thing but proof of red of You Yanguo prince, adjure a help I am chased after return this debt.
sentences.chinese: 这件事可由燕国太子丹证明，恳请帮助我追还这笔债。

sentences.english: Which to adjure to help it is good to reply?
sentences.chinese: 恳请哪位帮忙回答一下好么？

sentences.english: We implore all of you to remain calm and assure that you are in a safe place.
sentences.chinese: 我们恳请大家保持冷静，并保证你在一个安全的地方。

sentences.english: His Excellency entreats you by me.
Would you please send per return of post all the information you can get respecting Messrs. Ishii & Co. ?
sentences.chinese: 恳请尽量提早告知有关石井公司的各项情报。

sentences.english: Red Cross appeals to the public for generous donations to help the victims in need.
sentences.chinese: 红十字会恳请市民慷慨捐输，以助他们渡过难关。

sentences.english: FIRST solicits partial sponsorship for the annual conferences.
sentences.chinese: FIRST为每年的会议恳请赞助。

sentences.english: But I plead them to take the time to reconsider their choices about the annotations.
sentences.chinese: 但是我恳请他们花时间重新考虑关于注解的决定。

sentences.english: I entreat this favour of you.
I ask them to stand calm and firm and united in this time of trial.
sentences.chinese: 我恳请大家保持冷静和坚定，在考验面请团结起来。
她恳请我给她一些建议。

sentences.english: Defendant respectfully demand trial by jury of all issues so triable .
sentences.chinese: 被告恳请陪审团参与所有审判问题审理。

sentences.english: I implore you to go now.
We solicit a continuance of your confidence and support.
sentences.chinese: 恳请贵方持续赐与信赖，大年夜力撑持。

sentences.english: But he told the CIA staff not to be discouraged.
sentences.chinese: 但是他恳请中央情报局的全体员工不要泄气。

sentences.english: The drivers whose cars had crashed appealed for help from passing motorists.
sentences.chinese: 两车相撞后，两位司机恳请路过的驾驶员给予帮助。

definition: to be generous (idiom)/to be magnanimous/Give me a break!
to call on (sb to do sth)/to appeal (to)/an appeal
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
(courteous) to be so bold as to
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
to give a favor (used of Christian God)
